verses.verse: Now Sarai,<WH8297> Abram<WH87>'s wife,<WH802> bore<WH3205> him no<WH3808> children.<WH3205> She had a handmaid,<WH8198> an Egyptian,<WH4713> whose name<WH8034> was Hagar.<WH1904>

Sarai<WH8297> said<WH559> to Abram,<WH87> "See now,<WH3068> Yahweh has restrained me<WH6113> from bearing.<WH3205> Please go in<WH935> to my handmaid.<WH8198> It may<WH194> be that I will obtain children<WH1129> by her.<WH87>" Abram listened<WH8085> to the voice<WH6963> of Sarai.<WH8297>

Sarai,<WH8297> Abram<WH87>'s wife,<WH802> took<WH3947> Hagar<WH1904> the Egyptian,<WH4713> her handmaid,<WH8198> after<WH7093> Abram<WH87> had lived<WH3427> ten<WH6235> years<WH8141> in the land<WH776> of Canaan,<WH3667> and gave<WH5414> her to Abram<WH87> her husband<WH376> to be his wife.<WH802>
He went in<WH935> to Hagar,<WH1904> and she conceived.<WH2029> When she saw<WH7200> that she had conceived,<WH2029> her mistress<WH1404> was despised<WH7043> in her eyes.<WH5869>

Sarai<WH8297> said<WH559> to Abram,<WH87> "This wrong<WH2555> is your fault.<WH5414> I gave my handmaid<WH8198> into your bosom,<WH2436> and when she saw<WH7200> that she had conceived,<WH2029> I was despised<WH7043> in her eyes.<WH5869> Yahweh<WH3068> judge between me and you.<WH8199>"

But Abram<WH87> said<WH559> to Sarai,<WH8297> "Behold,<WH8198> your maid is in your hand.<WH3027> Do<WH6213> to her whatever is good in your<WH2896> eyes.<WH8297>" Sarai dealt harshly with<WH6031> her,<WH1272> and she fled from her face.<WH6440>
The angel<WH4397> of Yahweh<WH3068> found her<WH4672> by a fountain<WH5869> of water<WH4325> in the wilderness,<WH4057> by the fountain<WH5869> in the way<WH1870> to Shur.<WH7793>

He said,<WH559> "Hagar,<WH1904> Sarai<WH8297>'s handmaid,<WH8198> where<WH335> did you<WH935> come from?<WH3212> Where are you going?" She said,<WH559> "I am fleeing<WH1272> from the face<WH6440> of my mistress<WH1404> Sarai.<WH8297>"
The angel<WH4397> of Yahweh<WH3068> said<WH559> to her,<WH7725> "Return to your mistress,<WH1404> and submit<WH6031> yourself under her hands.<WH3027>"
The angel<WH4397> of Yahweh<WH3068> said<WH559> to her,<WH7235> "I will greatly multiply<WH7235> your seed,<WH2233> that they will not be numbered<WH5608> for multitude.<WH7230>"

The angel<WH4397> of Yahweh<WH3068> said<WH559> to her,<WH2009> "Behold, you are with child,<WH2030> and will bear<WH3205> a son.<WH1121> You shall call<WH7121> his name<WH8034> Ishmael,<WH3458> because Yahweh<WH3068> has heard<WH8085> your affliction.<WH6040>

He will be like a wild<WH6501> donkey<WH120> among men.<WH3027> His hand will be against every man,<WH3027> and every man's hand against him.<WH7931> He will live opposite<WH6440> all of his brothers.<WH251>"

She called<WH7121> the name<WH8034> of Yahweh<WH3068> who spoke<WH1696> to her,<WH410> "You are a God who sees,<WH7210>" for she said,<WH559> "Have I even stayed<WH1988> alive after seeing<WH7200> him?<WH310>"
Therefore the well<WH875> was called<WH7121> Beer<WH883> Lahai Roi.<WH6946> Behold, it is between Kadesh and Bered.<WH1260>
Hagar<WH1904> bore<WH3205> a son<WH1121> for Abram.<WH87> Abram<WH87> called<WH7121> the name<WH8034> of his son,<WH1121> whom Hagar<WH1904> bore,<WH3458> Ishmael.
